abstract.t: Content distribution prevails in today's Internet and Content-Centric Networking (CCN) proposes to access the data directly by their content instead of their location. In this memo we present a LISP based solution to interconnect CCN routers over the Internet. We first describe how content names can be encoded in LISP with LCAF. We then detail the operations of CCN routers to determine the CCN routers to which forward Interest and Data messages.
